definition: to await death/to be a sitting duck
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
to stay
to die/to shoot dead/to reject/to fall forward/(suffix) to death
to collapse/variant of 斃|毙[bi4]/variant of 獙[bi4]
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction

sentences.english: But that doesn’t mean Guangdong Province is sitting idle.
sentences.chinese: 不过，这并不意味着广东省正在坐以待毙。

sentences.english: Country full of open-minded hatred of hate at home, Wu may not want to sit still.
sentences.chinese: 国恨家仇满襟怀，伍子胥可不愿坐以待毙。

sentences.english: Tom would not await his doom.
We can do nothing and get swamped, or learn to surf and ride the wave.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以束手待毙，或者学会冲浪，驾驭浪潮。

sentences.english: Then my last illness seized me, and I returned hither to die.
sentences.chinese: 后来，致命的疾病缠住了我，我回到这里已奄奄待毙。

sentences.english: We are sitting ducks in a celestial shooting gallery, an asteroid might strike at any time.
sentences.chinese: 我们正坐以待毙，一颗小游星会随时随地撞击地球。

sentences.english: Moneyed elites are no slouches when it comes to defending their interests.
sentences.chinese: 有钱的精英们在捍卫他们的利益时决不会坐以待毙。

definition: to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
to sit and watch, but remain indifferent (idiom)
hands tied and waiting to be captured
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to burn both jade and common stone/to destroy indiscriminately (idiom)
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
to extend one's neck in preparation for execution (idiom)
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over
lit. to strike a stone with egg (idiom); to attempt the impossible/to invite disaster by overreaching oneself
(idiom) dead end/road to ruin
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
to have one's hands tied/helpless/unable to do anything about it
